topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55668cd96368724141e81800#post_55668cd96368724141e81800
I've been there once, and I LOVED it. The place was clean and inviting, And what really stood out to was the workers. They were all super friendly and nice. And not that phony "I work so I have to pretend to be happy" shenanigans either. It felt like the people working there genuinely loved their job. I know a fake smile when I see one, and there were no fake smiles to be seen. Hell even all the costumed actors like Mickey and Donald. You know they had to have been suffering in those suits but they were always friendly to the kids.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

however, me being the paranoid nut that I am, something always seems sinister to me.
maybe it's just leftovers from where I was terrified of half of the rides there as a kid.
